pullRequest.body: Define Legendre polynomials and prove that it is integer polynomial. In the same time, its evaluation on x is equal to the evaluation on 1 - x.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [8bc038b064](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17500/commits/8bc038b06444345c06e368336c86bcf30b8aa19a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.LegendrePoly`|1260|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Finsum_iterate_deriv`
`+ Legendre`
`+ Legendre_eq_int_poly`
`+ Legendre_eq_sum`
`+ Legendre_eval_symm`
`+ deriv_one_sub_X`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Can you please fix the error?

> Can you please fix the error?

it tells me that Polynomial.Legendre definition missing documentation string. I don't know how to fix this error.

> > Can you please fix the error?
> 
> it tells me that Polynomial.Legendre definition missing documentation string. I don't know how to fix this error.

Any definition must have a docstring. Just write something like
```lean
/--  `Legendre n` is the polynomial blahblah -/
noncomputable def Legendre (n : ℕ) : ℝ[X] :=
```

> > > Can you please fix the error?
> > 
> > 
> > it tells me that Polynomial.Legendre definition missing documentation string. I don't know how to fix this error.
> 
> Any definition must have a docstring. Just write something like
> 
> ```lean
> /--  `Legendre n` is the polynomial blahblah -/
> noncomputable def Legendre (n : ℕ) : ℝ[X] :=
> ```

thanks for suggestion. I have fixed the error.

pullRequest.title: feat: Define Legendre polynomials and prove some basic prop.
